result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Duane Fedderly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Duane Fedderly

defendant.name: Fedderly, Scott Duane
defendant.address: N206 Sabin Avenue, Spring Valley, WI 54767

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:12 a.m.  Defendant Scott Duane Fedderly in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie - have an agreement, amend charge to 1 cournt of misdemeanor possession of THC, Thorie will file amended information when prepared.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Judge reviews plea waiver with defendant.    Court reviews amended charge and maximum penalties.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Thorie to file amended information.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to amended Count 1 - possession of THC.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA to count 1 in amended information, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  O'Boyle stipulates to factual basis.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of amended charge of possession of THC.  Court orders fine of $265.60, 6 months to pay.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Criminal Jury Trial Scheduling Order

Final pre-trial at 09-01-2015 10:45 am.
Jury trial at 09-24-2015 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 05-20-2015 03:45 pm.
from JMOBoyle with response from Judge - ok
with response from Judge Boles
asking that the motion hearing be changed to a scheduling conference
Motion hearing at 04-14-2015 02:00 pm.
from Attorney John OBoyle to Judge Boles regarding continuance of 3-3-15 hearing.
filed by Wm Thorie
Motion hearing at 03-03-2015 03:00 pm.
filed by JMOBoyle
Pre-trial conference on February 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Further reading waived.    DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY TO BOTH COUNTS.

9:06 am 
Defendant Scott Duane Fedderly in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense moves to sequester witnesses.  So ordered.  John Dubois, Chief of Police, Village of Spring Valley sworn and examined by ADA Thorie.  Witness IDs defendant.  Record so reflects.  Atty OBoyle x-exams.  Thorie redirects.  Investigator Marty Shepler sworn and examined by ADA Thorie.  O'Boyle x-exams.  Thorie makes argument.  OBoyle makes argument.  Thorie rebuttal.  Court finds probable cause and binds over on Count 1.  Thorie addresses the Meth charge, Count 2.  Thorie asks Court to delay arraignment and he will file an Information without Count 2.  Court does not find probable cause on Count 2.  Different Information will be filed.   
Adjourn to file new Information.  
9:48 am  All parties present in the courtroom.  Bond conditions to remain the same.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on January 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
